result.execSummary:
The defendant Sirmilton Freeman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: To Counts 2 & 3 as amended.
Court will allow work release ONKY if defendant is employed at the time of revocation.
Probation review hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 8:30am.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge. Court WAIVED DNA surcharges on Counts 2 and 3 as AMENDED, as they are a part of a continuous event.
If revoked, court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds.

Obtain/maintain full time employment. If defendant is not employed full time, he must be employed part time and enrolled in school part time.
Participate in vocational training.

Court will defer ruling on sex offender registration until the probation review hearing date.
Court ordered a probation review hearing be set. AODA agency to prepare a report regarding defendant's progress on probation for the next court date.
Defendant to prepare a letter for the Court that discusses the consequences of his behavior on the victim, on his family and others, and what is learned from this behavior.

AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment and counseling.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Complete 80 hours of community service at an agency that is pre-approved by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for probation review hearing. Sex Offender Program Report and Probation Status Review received and filed. Probation Agent Damon Boustany also present in court. Discussion regarding the progress reports. State is not recommending sex offender registration. Defendant is in compliance with conditions of probation. Court will NOT require the defendant to register as a sex offender and found no future court date is needed at this time.

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for probation review hearing. No probation present in court. Parties have not received an updated progress report from the agent. Court ordered the matter adjourned for the parties to contact the agent. Branch 25 will keep this matter post-rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court retained this matter post-rotation. Case transferred back to Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Cynthia M. Davis on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for probation review hearing. Probation Agent Kimberly Betzholdt also present in court. Probation Status Review Report received and filed. Defendant is mostly compliant with the terms of probation. Discussion regarding defendant's positive drug test. Court ordered this matter be set for an additional review date to render a ruling on sex offender registration. Court will retain this matter post-rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Bail refund notice and Affidavit mailed to surety 11/28/2014. LJ
Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered pleas  of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Case is adjourned to 11-24-2014 at 8:30am for sentencing in Branch 25.

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 25.
Amended Information filed: 3 counts of Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, class A misdemeanors 940.225(3m).  Defense waived reading.
Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Branch 38 agreed to hear this matter on behalf of Branch 25. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties are still in negotiations and request an additional date prior to the jury trial date. Discussion regarding witness on both the State and defense witness lists. Court will hear request for adjournment at the next court date. State has filed all pretrial documents. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/13/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties are prepared to proceed to jury trial. State needs to file pretrial documents and requests additional final pretrial date. Parties may reach a resolution prior to trial. Court grants request for additional final pretrial date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on  10/13/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense motion in limine recieved and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for calendar call.  Defense provided court with proof of the funeral.  Court vacated the bench warrant issued and stayed. Defense request a trial date. Parties advised as of August 1, 2014 this matter will be reassigned to Judge Konkol, Br 44.   Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.  Case set for final pretrial on 10/01/2014 at 8:30 am.  Jury trial set for 10/13/2014 at 9:00am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Case adjourned to Br 25.
JusticePoint report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense counsel previously notified the court about a death in the defendant's family and his non appearance.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.    Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Calendar call scheduled for 07-17-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Paul L Tiffin on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense has received an offer and request a plea hearing.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-11-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Introduce DNA Evidence received and filed.

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense has received discovery and an offer but needs additional time to review the offer with the defendant.  Defense believes this matter will resolve prior to trial.   Discussion regarding JusticePoint report. Court admonished the defendant for his postivie test.  Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Status conference scheduled for 06-18-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 05/08/14. AR

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/5/14.

14RM022686  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04/26/14 LJ
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with L.S.J. and S.O.W.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Sirmilton Freeman in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
